decks.notes: This deck aims to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman. It also utilizes disruption through cards like Hymn to Tourach, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's gameplan. The deck has a good amount of control elements with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Daze, and Abrupt Decay to manage the opponent's threats. It also has strong card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws. The mana base consists of fetchlands and dual lands to provide flexibility in casting spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using various counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage and manipulation through cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sensei's Divining Top. It has a win condition in the form of Entreat the Angels and focuses on stabilizing the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Terminus. The deck also has a small red splash for cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to deal with specific threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume. The combo aspect is further supported by cards like Show and Tell and Force of Will to protect these creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes control elements like Thoughtseize and Daze to help stall the opponent while setting up the combo. The powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Iona, and Elesh Norn serve as win conditions once they hit the battlefield.

The focus of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, board wipes, card draw, and manipulating the top of the deck. This UWx Control deck utilizes powerful control elements like Counterbalance, Snapcaster Mage, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor while also having win condition in Entreat the Angels. The mana base is built to support a variety of spells and allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. The deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents by carefully managing resources and making strategic decisions.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting opponents while deploying threats that can close out the game. It uses efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis alongside disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for spells. Additionally, cards like Deathrite Shaman and Wasteland provide extra utility and disruption. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, leveraging the strength of BUG colors in Legacy format.

The deck focuses on using a combination of control elements and powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to outvalue and outlast opponents. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage alongside efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while simultaneously establishing a strong board presence with equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The mana base is tailored to support a variety of colors for versatility in spell casting while also including utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas for added flexibility.

The main concept of this combo deck is to use cards like Painter's Servant and Grindstone to quickly and efficiently mill your opponent's entire library. This is complemented by cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to disrupt your opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game. Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast are used for protection and removal, while cards like Enlightened Tutor and Imperial Recruiter help tutor for key pieces of the combo. Additionally, Goblin Welder provides additional synergy by recurring important artifacts from the graveyard.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control and manipulate the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck focuses on using cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to deal with threats. The deck also looks to generate card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage, Vendilion Clique, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The goal is to control the game and win through incremental advantage and powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels.

The deck aims to assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation and Living Wish to find key pieces. It utilizes powerful card draw and control elements like Brainstorm and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Exploration allows for fast mana ramping, while Life from the Loam provides graveyard recursion. Supreme Verdict acts as a board wipe to deal with aggressive strategies. The deck thrives on its ability to quickly assemble its combo while maintaining control over the game.

The key concept of this Aggro-Canadian Threshold deck is to quickly establish board presence and control the game with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Tarmogoyf, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while also having access to counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Lightning Bolt and Grim Lavamancer to maintain tempo. With a mana base focused on fetch lands and dual lands, the deck can consistently access its spells while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana and drawing cards with the help of elves, specifically through cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Glimpse of Nature. It aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed for a lethal attack, typically involving a Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes disruption elements like Scavenging Ooze and Ruric Thar, the Unbowed to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo finish, utilizing the mana acceleration provided by cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Nic Fit strategy to control the game by using various creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key idea is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Veteran Explorer and accelerate into powerful threats like Grave Titan and Glen Elendra Archmage. The deck also has a toolbox approach with Birthing Pod and Green Sun's Zenith to find specific answers to different situations. Overall, the main objective is to establish board control and outvalue the opponent through efficient creature recursion and disruption spells.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures before they have a chance to react, leading to a swift victory. The deck aims to create explosive plays and win the game through its combo-centric strategy.

The main concept of this Combo - Show and Tell Legacy deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield by utilizing cards such as Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Lotus Petal. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also cantripping through the deck with Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, Ponder, and Preordain. The deck also includes lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to accelerate the mana needed to execute the combo strategy effectively.

The main concept of this Legacy combo deck is to quickly put powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck includes card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key combo pieces, along with disruption in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game by cheating out big creatures early on and overwhelming the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting opponents with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Liliana of the Veil while also utilizing powerful creatures such as Stoneforge Mystic, True-Name Nemesis, and Snapcaster Mage. The goal is to establish board presence with equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, while also having access to versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck's mana base is designed to support multiple colors and includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland for additional disruption.
